page.title: 16MANOR FARM, SOUTHAM
page.content: THERE ARE 400 ACRES BELONGING TO MANOR FARM.THE LARGE FARM HOUSE WAS BUILT IN THE 12TH CENTURY.IT STILL HAS AN OLD MOUNTING BLOCK AND MILL WHEEL.AT THE FARM THEY BREED LARGE WHITE PIGS AND EXPORT THEM ALL OVER THE WORLD EXCEPT TO AFRICA.THERE ARE ABOUT 2000 PIGS OF WHICH 150 ARE SOWS.THE OLDEST PIG WE SAW WAS 3 YEARS OLD AND WEIGHED 380 KILOGRAMS.MR.AND MRS. ORGAN HAVE SEVERAL FARROWING AND WEANING HOUSES FOR THE PIGS.THE PIGS ARE OVER 100 DAYS OLD WHEN THEY ARE SOLD.MANY OF THEM WIN PRIZES IN THE NATIONAL SHOWS.THE BACON IS OF THE HIGHEST QUALITY. ALSO AT THE FARM WERE 100 DAIRY FRESIANS. THEY ARE MILKED IN THE MORNING AND EVENING. MR.AND MRS. ORGAN MAKE THEIR OWN HAY AND SILAGE AND GROW SPRING BARLEY AND BEETS TO FEED TO THE ANIMALS.THEY KEEP A FEW SHEEP AND BEEF CATTLE.
